intro: Herpestis andicola, commonly known as the Andean mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It is often found at high altitudes, where it adapts to the harsh climatic conditions. Herpestis andicola plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a habitat for small invertebrates.
